thread.title: Schools: Watertown field hockey streaks to 150
thread.title_full: Schools: Watertown field hockey streaks to 150 | Boston Herald

author: Herald Staff
title: Schools: Watertown field hockey streaks to 150
text:
The Watertown field hockey team extended its unbeaten run to 150 games with a 4-0 win over Belmont yesterday in a Middlesex League contest. The Raiders (12-0) got two goals from Michaela Antonellis and single tallies from Ally McCall and Maddie Leitner.
Watertown is 147-0-3 since the start of the 2009 season and has won 90 straight games since a tie against Wilmington on Oct. 18, 2011. Voorhees (N.J.) Eastern owns the longest unbeaten streak in field hockey at 153 games.
Emily Devine scored four goals as Lexington (8-3) defeated Burlington , 5-1, in a Middlesex crossover game.
In a nonleague game, Julia Neelon scored twice and added an assist as Notre Dame-Hingham (8-2-2) posted a 5-0 blanking of Brockton .
Boys soccer
Matt Raymond made the biggest of his seven saves with one minute remaining to ensure Hamilton-Wenham (8-1-3) came away with a 0-0 tie against North Reading (4-2-5) in a Cape Ann League game. North Reading keeper Billy Brandano made five saves for his seventh clean sheet of the year.
In a Bay State Conference contest, Oliver Priebe and John Elcock scored a goal apiece as Brookline (5-2-3) blanked Natick , 2-0.
North Andover (9-1-1) clinched a spot in the postseason with a 1-0 win over Central Catholic , with Stephen Stabile scoring in the first half.
Clayton Rodrigues scored the lone goal as Quincy (6-3) edged Hanover , 1-0, in a Patriot League matchup.
Girls soccer
In Bay State Conference action, Emma Spector scored twice as Needham (9-0-2) blanked Milton , 4-0.
Liz Kischner scored her tenth goal of the season as Hamilton-Wenham (12-0) defeated North Reading , 1-0, in the Cape Ann League.
Girls volleyball
In Catholic Central play, Demi Fogarty recorded 19 kills and Monica Royo added 10 as Arlington Catholic (12-0) defeated Archbishop Williams , 3-0. . . . Melissa MacKenzie finished with 15 kills to lead Bishop Fenwick (10-1) to a 3-1 victory over Cardinal Spellman .
In Eastern Athletic Conference action, Lauren Manis finished with 14 kills and two blocks to lead Bishop Feehan (5-4) past Somerset Berkley , 3-0.
In the Bay State Conference, Maddy Brown finished with five kills and 12 service points as Milton (7-4) defeated Needham , 3-2.
In a Mayflower League contest, Kim Sian recorded 13 kills and Kasey Zaleski had 10 aces to lift Blue Hills (8-5) past Diman , 3-0.
Dan Keats, Kevin Barrucci and Sean Brennan compiled this report.
